intro: Stevenia alyssoides, commonly known as the common stevenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has evergreen foliage and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability. Stevenia alyssoides is also valued for its use in traditional medicine in some regions.
